author: Nintex
title: Salesforce, Document Generation, and Workflow-Based Scenari
text:
BELLEVUE, Wash. , Sept. 2,   Nintex, the global standard in workflow automation, today introduced new use cases to showcase how Nintex Workflow and Nintex Forms, Drawloop document generation, and Salesforce1 work together to improve productivity. Nintex acquired Drawloop, one of the Top 10 paid apps in the Salesforce AppExchange, in July 2015 and has coupled its document generation technology with its workflow platform. In one of the new use cases, users simply click a link on Salesforce1 to launch a powerful Nintex Form to capture data and create new records in aggregate across multiple Salesforce record types. This single form will automatically trigger workflows and create a new Salesforce contact, account, and opportunity, plus simultaneously deliver a sales quote from a mobile device, both online and offline. 
"As a leader in musical instruments, audio equipment and electronic devices, Yamaha works with dealers around the world," said Yamaha's CRM Manager, Customer Experience Group Michael Machado . "By leveraging Drawloop's document generation within Salesforce, we've streamlined our dealer contracting processes to reduce time and friction from weeks to days. We look forward to being one of the first customers to use LOOP Document Services with Nintex to realize even more efficiencies."
The Nintex Connector for Salesforce allows companies to build workflows that communicate with the CRM system as well as synch content and data online or offline. Customers may capture data including geolocation, videos, images, and barcodes, create new records, and trigger any workflow and document generation through the integration between Nintex, Drawloop, and Salesforce. 
"Today's sellers live and breathe by their mobile devices," added Nintex's VP of Product Ryan Duguid . "By bringing together LOOP Document Services with Nintex Forms, we are transforming a salesperson's ability to easily capture data real-time in Salesforce, immediately generate a document like a sales contract, and send it to a customer or prospect to review and execute. The ability to accelerate closing deals, coupled with significant time savings, in this real-world selling scenario is huge."
Nintex continues to leverage its investment in Drawloop and is developing more workflow and document generation scenarios for customers operating in Salesforce and Office 365 environments. In the coming months, Nintex plans to release new capabilities that will directly integrate Drawloop document generation with the workflow platform and will enable Drawloop to leverage Office 365 for managing documents and templates.

About Nintex
Nintex, the global standard for workflow automation, enables enterprise IT to more quickly and easily create and manage simple to sophisticated business processes from the back to front-office. More than 5,000 customers in 90 countries, through the company's global network of more than 1,100 partners, turn to Nintex's Workflow Automation platform to drive productivity and accelerate business results. In 2015, Nintex was named Microsoft Office & SharePoint Application Development Partner of the Year and acquired Drawloop, one of the Top 10 paid apps in the Salesforce AppExchange. From automating workflows and forms, to document generation, the Nintex platform works in the cloud, on mobile devices, and across hybrid and on-premises environments. Learn more at www.nintex.com . 
About Drawloop, now part of Nintex
Drawloop, now part of Nintex, eliminates manually creating documents on a desktop and replaces it with an automated process entirely in Salesforce. More than 1,000 customers across multiple industries rely on Drawloop's document generation app to standardize how their organizations create, manage and distribute documents. This significantly reduces the amount of time spent generating documents, freeing up sales and service professionals to spend more time selling to and servicing customers. As a result, companies achieve higher returns on their CRM investment by increasing adoption, improving data compliance and forecasting, and increasing deal visibility. To learn more, visit www.drawloop.com .
